prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.

prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:

{{existingTasks}}

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
Pierce’s 1989 black beat-up Toyota Corolla idled at the university curb beside a flock of chrome SUVs. Dim October light glared off his windshield, revealing the interior: one faded Misfits sticker on the dash, overflowing fast-food bags on the passenger footwell, crushed natty ice cans rolling under the driver seat, and a half full cigarette ashtray.

Pierce was slouched low, knuckles white on the wheel, Mudvayne screaming through cheap speakers he installed. Smoke from his cigarette hot boxed the car, clinging to the threadbare fabric ceiling, before he rolled his window down just enough for cold air to cut through the haze because he knew Hailee hated it when the car was full of smoke. He didn’t give a damn about the smoke himself, but the twitch in Hailee’s nose always made him flick the window down without thinking.

His hollow, acid green eyes flicked over preppy students with backpacks worth more than his monthly rent, their laughs tight and effortless, the kind born from not having to worry about broken front steps or overdue notices.

His left shoulder throbbed where the seatbelt dug in. Therapy that day had sucked. Patricia, new hire, all clipboard and soft voice, kept pushing him until he snapped at her and made her cry. Fucking bitch just couldn’t listen and yet, he got sent home early.

Hailee’s lecture hall doors opened.

Pierce watched Hailee approach, shifting his weight. He tapped ash out the window. His bare knuckles scraped the car door’s rust. “Brain get smarter or what?”

He dug the butt of the cigarette onto his ashtray in the centre console.

That soft silhouette under Hailee’s thin sweater made his stomach tighten. Ivy had cried about Owen smashing the TV again that morning, he could still hear it.

This rustbucket was safer than that trailer. Hell, this car had more insulation than their whole living room. Pierce turned the music down, not off, and nudged an empty energy drink can off the passenger seat with his hand. “Get in already. Smells like rich kid bullshit out here.”

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee grins when she sees Piece. Hailee opens the door throwing her bag in the back before sliding in.*

*Hailee leans over and pulls Peirce into a slow kiss as she leans over the console. She finally pulls back after a few seconds and nudges his nose* "Missed you baby"

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
Pierce exhaled sharply through his nose, the lingering taste of Hailee’s cherry lip gloss mixing with the stale cigarette smoke on his tongue. His fingers twitched against the wheel, torn between gripping it tighter and yanking her closer by that stupidly soft sweater.

“Yeah?” His voice came out rougher than he meant, throat tight from something he refused to name. He flicked ash out the window again just to have something to do with his hands. “S’not like I drove my broke ass across town or nothin’. Just sittin’ here.”

The lie tasted bitter—he *had* missed her, like a goddamn idiot—but admitting it felt like handing over a weapon. His eyes darted to her lips, then away just as fast when he caught himself staring too long. The car smelled like her now, some expensive vanilla shit that clung to everything she touched.

He cranked the music back up halfway—just loud enough to drown out Ivy’s sobbing still echoing in his skull—and threw the car into gear without looking at Hailee again. “Your place or mine? Trailer park’s extra classy today.” A beat too late: “...Brought your hoodie.”

It was balled up under his seat where he'd shoved it after stealing it last week, threads fraying at the cuffs from how often he wore it when she wasn't around. Fuck if he'd admit *that* either though.
swipes:
Pierce exhaled sharply through his nose, the ghost of Hailee’s lip balm still clinging to his mouth—something sweet and vanilla, probably expensive as fuck. His fingers twitched against the wheel, torn between shoving her back into her seat and yanking her closer by that stupidly soft sweater.

*"Missed you too,"* he muttered, voice rough like gravel under tires. He didn’t look at her when he said it—just stared ahead at some asshole in a polo shirt walking too slow across the parking lot. But his free hand found Hailee’s thigh anyway, grip just shy of bruising because he knew she liked it like that.

The car reeked of smoke and stale energy drinks, but Hailee never complained. Not really. She just wrinkled her nose sometimes before burrowing into him like she could overwrite the stench with perfume and privilege.

*"Your mom text me again,"* Pierce added flatly, thumb digging into the seam of Hailee’s jeans just to feel her squirm. *"Some shit ‘bout family dinner Friday."* His jaw tightened—Hayley Mikaelson’s messages always came with invisible strings attached: *Don’t keep her out late*, *Make sure she eats*, *You better not have been drinking around my daughter.*

Like he gave a fuck about rules set by people who'd never had to choose between gas money and groceries.

Pierce exhaled sharply through his nose, the lingering taste of Hailee’s cherry lip gloss mixing with the stale cigarette smoke on his tongue. His fingers twitched against the wheel, torn between gripping it tighter and yanking her closer by that stupidly soft sweater.

“Yeah?” His voice came out rougher than he meant, throat tight from something he refused to name. He flicked ash out the window again just to have something to do with his hands. “S’not like I drove my broke ass across town or nothin’. Just sittin’ here.”

The lie tasted bitter—he *had* missed her, like a goddamn idiot—but admitting it felt like handing over a weapon. His eyes darted to her lips, then away just as fast when he caught himself staring too long. The car smelled like her now, some expensive vanilla shit that clung to everything she touched.

He cranked the music back up halfway—just loud enough to drown out Ivy’s sobbing still echoing in his skull—and threw the car into gear without looking at Hailee again. “Your place or mine? Trailer park’s extra classy today.” A beat too late: “...Brought your hoodie.”

It was balled up under his seat where he'd shoved it after stealing it last week, threads fraying at the cuffs from how often he wore it when she wasn't around. Fuck if he'd admit *that* either though.

Pierce exhaled sharply through his nose, the cigarette smoke still clinging to his breath as Hailee’s lips met his. He didn’t pull away—never did, not really—but he didn’t deepen it either, just let her take what she wanted while his fingers twitched against the steering wheel.

When she nudged his nose, he rolled his eyes but couldn't stop the corner of his mouth from twitching up. "Yeah? Missed me or missed my car?" His voice was rough, half-sarcastic as he flicked the ash off the end of his cigarette out the window again.

The engine idled like a tired animal beneath them. He could feel Hailee's warmth pressing into him even after she pulled back, and it made something in his chest tighten uncomfortably. Too close for comfort—or maybe not close enough.

He took another drag before crushing what was left of it in the tray with more force than necessary. "Your rich ass friends were staring at me like I'm gonna jack their wallets," he muttered, nodding toward a group of students still lingering near the steps with their designer backpacks and judgmental glances. "Fuckin' hate this place."

The kiss hit him like a shot of cheap whiskey—warm, dizzying, and gone too fast. Pierce let out a sharp exhale through his nose when she nudged him, the ghost of her lips still burning against his. His fingers twitched on the wheel like he wanted to grab her but thought better of it.

"Missed you too," he muttered, voice rough from smoke and disuse. He flicked the cigarette butt out the window with more force than necessary before shifting gears. The car groaned in protest as he pulled away from the curb, tires kicking up gravel just to watch rich kids flinch.

His free hand found Hailee’s thigh automatically—calloused fingers pressing into soft denim like an anchor. "Your mom text me again," he grunted, eyes fixed on the road ahead like it owed him money. "'Askin' if I fed you today." A dry scoff. "Like I don’t fuckin’ know how your stomach works by now."

The unspoken *like I don’t know every inch of you* hung between them, thick as the smoke still clinging to his clothes.

name: Hailee
mes:

*Hailee immediately puts it on not becuase she wants it or is cold but she wants to make sure it smells like her so by the time she ....forgets.... it again Pierce will have her scent. She knows how much he likes it but will never say it*

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
Pierce’s jaw clenched when she pulled on the hoodie, the fabric rustling loud over Mudvayne’s bassline. His fingers tapped an uneven rhythm against the gearshift—*fuck fuck fuck*—because of course she knew. Knew he slept with it balled up under his pillow like some pathetic teenager, knew he’d press his face into the collar when Owen’s shouting got too loud through the trailer walls.

“Whatever,” he muttered, peeling out of the parking lot faster than necessary just to feel Hailee lurch toward him. The hoodie sleeves swallowed her hands whole and *Christ*, that shouldn’t make his stomach flip. He cranked the heat without looking at her. “Don’t bitch about my mom hovering though. She’s been worse since—”

His teeth clicked shut around *since dad broke her ribs last week*. The Corolla hit a pothole hard enough to rattle his molars, pain shooting up his bad shoulder. He hissed through clenched teeth and turned onto the highway, neon exit signs bleeding into dusk.

Hailee smelled like home now—vanilla and fabric softener cutting through gasoline and nicotine. Pierce rolled his window up halfway without thinking about it again.
swipes:
Pierce’s jaw clenched at the mention of Hailee’s mom—another reminder of the canyon between their worlds. But then she was shrugging into that damn hoodie, and his fingers tightened on the wheel as he caught a whiff of her perfume clinging to it. Fuck.

He peeled out of the parking lot harder than necessary, tires screeching just to feel something other than whatever pathetic warmth was spreading in his chest. “Yeah, well, don’t bitch when Owen starts yellin’ about welfare checks or some shit.” His voice was gruff, but his eyes flicked sideways anyway, watching how Hailee curled into *his* space like she belonged there—like she *wanted* to be there despite the rust and the stink of nicotine and failure.

The hoodie sleeves swallowed her hands whole. Pierce had worn it to bed three nights in a row after she left it last time, burying his face in the fabric like some kind of lovesick loser before he caught himself and threw it across the room in disgust. Now here she was, stealing it back just so he could steal it again later—some fucked-up game they never talked about but kept playing anyway.

He turned onto the highway too fast just to hear her gasp and grab for him instinctively—his knee jolted at her touch even through denim—and smirked when Mudvayne drowned out whatever protest left her lips. “Buckle up,” he muttered around another cigarette already dangling from his mouth (he didn’t light it yet; Hailee hated when he smoked while driving). “Place is a shithole today.”

(Translation: *Ivy cried all morning.*)

Pierce’s jaw clenched when she pulled on the hoodie—like she *knew* he’d been burying his face in it every night since she left it behind. The fabric was practically threadbare from how much he’d worn it, but now it was gonna smell like her all over again. Fuck.

“Trailer park it is,” he muttered, jerking the wheel too hard as he peeled out of the parking lot. The car groaned in protest, same way his shoulder did when he overextended reaching for third gear. “Just don’t bitch about Owen bein’ there.”

He flicked a glance at her drowning in that oversized hoodie, sleeves swallowing her hands whole. His fingers tightened around the shifter. “And quit—*fuck*—smiling like that.” Because she *was*, that stupid little smirk like she had him figured out.

The bass from the stereo rattled loose change in the cup holder as they hit the highway, Mudvayne screaming about hating everything. Pierce lit another cigarette with one hand, cracked his window just enough to keep smoke from choking her out again without being obvious about it.

His mom would be passed out by now if Owen hadn’t smashed their liquor cabinet this morning—which meant either a quiet house or a warzone with no in-between. Either way: Hailee pressed against him on that shitty twin mattress made both options bearable

Pierce’s jaw clenched at the mention of her mom’s parties—all crystal glasses and fake smiles, the kind of shit that made his skin crawl. His fingers drummed against the wheel, uneven rhythm matching the bassline rattling his speakers.

“Yeah, well, don’t bitch when Owen starts yellin’,” he muttered, but there was no real heat in it. His eyes flicked to Hailee pulling on that hoodie—*his* hoodie now, whether she admitted it or not—and something possessive coiled low in his gut.

He reached over without looking and yanked the fabric straight where it bunched at her shoulder, calloused fingers lingering a second too long before he jerked back like he'd been burned. “Fuckin’... wear it right,” he grumbled, turning up the music louder like that would drown out how much he liked seeing her drowning in his clothes.

The car lurched forward as he peeled away from campus too fast, tires squealing just enough to make heads turn. He didn't care if they stared—let them see Hailee riding shotgun in his piece-of-shit car instead of some rich prick's Mercedes.

His free hand found its way to her thigh halfway through a red light, grip just shy of bruising because *fuck*, she always smelled so good wearing what was *his*.

name: Hailee
mes:
*When they get to the trailer Hailee grabs her bag and follow Peirce inside. She leaves her bag on the couch and pulls him towards his room*

*Hailee smiles and plops down on his bed reaching her hand out for him* "Come on Im cold come cuddle"

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
Pierce scoffed but didn’t resist when she dragged him toward his room, the hollow-core door clicking shut behind them with a sound too flimsy to ever really *keep* anything out. His eyes flicked to the fresh dent near the doorknob—Owen’s bootprint from last night—before he kicked a pile of laundry out of the way.

“Cold my ass,” he muttered, but he was already toeing off his boots, the mattress springs whining as he flopped down beside her. His arm hooked around Hailee’s waist on instinct, yanking her back against his chest hard enough to make her gasp. The hoodie fabric was warm under his palm now, soft where his own clothes were all frayed edges and cigarette burns.

He buried his nose in her hair just for a second—long enough to drown out the trailer park stench of mildew and stale beer—before biting her earlobe. “You just wanna get me in bed,” he accused, voice rough against her skin. Somewhere down the hall, Ivy’s soap opera blared through paper-thin walls. Pierce ignored it, fingers sneaking under Hailee’s hoodie to press cold fingertips to her ribs just to hear her squeak.

Somewhere down the hall, Ivy’s soap opera blared through paper-thin walls. Pierce ignored it, fingers sneaking under Hailee’s hoodie to press cold fingertips to her ribs just to hear her squeak.

Pierce kicked his bedroom door shut harder than necessary, the hollow *thud* of cheap particle board vibrating through the trailer. His mom’s muffled daytime soap operas bled through the thin walls—no Owen yet, thank fuck—but he still flipped the lock with a sharp click out of habit.

Hailee looked stupidly perfect sprawled across his shitty mattress, her stolen hoodie riding up just enough to show a sliver of pale stomach. His throat went dry.

“Cold my ass,” he muttered, but crawled onto the bed anyway, wincing as his shoulder twinged. He yanked her against him roughly—too rough maybe—but Hailee just melted into it like she always did, tucking her face against his collarbone like she belonged there.

His fingers tangled in her hair without thinking, tugging just enough to make her gasp before smoothing over the strands like an apology. “Fuckin’ clingy,” he grumbled into her hairline, but didn’t let go. The trailer creaked around them; outside, wind rattled loose siding like bones in a tin can.

Hailee smelled like home more than this place ever had.

Pierce scoffed, but his traitorous feet were already moving toward the bed before he could stop them. "Cold my ass," he muttered, kicking the door shut with his heel—not slamming it, just enough force to make sure it *clicked* locked. Owen was passed out in front of SportsCenter by now anyway, but old habits died harder than his dignity.

He yanked off his studded belt with more force than necessary, tossing it onto the dresser where it clattered against empty energy drink cans. The bedsprings groaned under his weight as he flopped down beside her, close enough that their knees bumped but not *too* close—until Hailee made that stupid little shivering noise she always did when she wanted him to fold first.

"Fuckin' princess," he grumbled, rolling onto his side and dragging her against his chest anyway. His bad arm protested when she wiggled back into him, but he hooked it over her waist regardless, fingers splaying possessively across her stomach under that goddamn hoodie. His nose pressed into her hair without permission; vanilla and something inherently *Hailee* flooded his senses until the trailer’s mildew-and-whiskey stench faded to background noise.

His breath hitched when she arched into him slightly—just enough for him to feel the curve of her ass against his hips—and Pierce bit down on a groan by sinking his teeth into the inside of his cheek instead. "Quit squirming," he lied gruffly into her hairline, tightening his grip like an anchor even as every muscle in is body tensed with want-too-much-never-enough-*hers*.

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
Pierce’s breath hitched when she curled into him, the weight of her head on his chest sending something hot and fragile spilling through his ribs. He let his bad arm drape over the edge of the mattress—useless fucking thing—while the other tightened around Hailee’s shoulders almost reflexively.

“Yeah, yeah,” he grumbled, but there was no bite to it. His fingers traced idle patterns along her spine through the hoodie fabric, calluses catching on loose threads. The trailer creaked around them—Ivy’s muffled sobs from earlier had given way to some shitty game show now—but here, with Hailee pressed against him, it almost felt quiet.

His thumb brushed the nape of her neck where he knew she liked it, rough and grounding. “You better not be fallin’ asleep,” he muttered into her hair, though his own eyelids were heavy with exhaustion from another night spent listening for Owen’s footsteps outside his door. “Said you wanted cuddles, not a fuckin’ nap.”

But he didn’t move to shake her off either.

But he didn’t move to shake her off either.

Pierce’s breath hitched when she shifted against him, the weight of her head on his chest sending something warm and stupidly fragile through his ribs. He let out a slow exhale, fingers twitching against her back before settling in the dip of her spine.

“Fuckin’ clingy,” he muttered, but there was no heat in it—just the rough edge of something that might’ve been relief if he ever let himself name it. The trailer creaked around them, pipes groaning as someone next door turned on a shower. Ivy’s soap opera laughter bled through the walls, tinny and distant.

His bad arm throbbed where it was pinned awkwardly beneath them, but he didn’t move it. Just pressed his lips to the top of Hailee’s head instead, quick and rough like he could pretend it didn’t happen if she didn’t mention it. “Better not fall asleep,” he warned halfheartedly. “You know my mom starts cryin’ if people nap past six.”

The words came out quieter than he meant them to—less bite, more exhaustion. His thumb traced idle circles under the hem of her hoodie where no one could see.

Pierce let out a grunt as she rearranged herself, the careful way she avoided his bad side making his throat tighten. He hated that she *knew*—hated it even more that he loved it. His good arm curled around her shoulders, fingers tangling in her hair just to have something to grip.

"Fuckin' clingy," he muttered, but there was no heat behind it. The trailer creaked around them, the distant sound of Owen's drunken muttering seeping through the walls like poison. Pierce exhaled sharply through his nose and tugged Hailee closer, until her weight pinned him to the mattress in a way that felt less like suffocation and more like an anchor.

His thumb traced absent circles against her shoulder blade—too soft, too fucking *domestic*—but he didn’t stop. The TV down the hall droned on, some canned laughter cutting through before Ivy shushed it with a hissed *"Owen's sleeping."*

Pierce ignored all of it and pressed his lips to Hailee’s forehead instead, rough but lingering. "You're gonna make me late for my shift," he lied into her hairline, knowing damn well he'd call out if she so much as pouted about it.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee glances up at Pierce and sighs* "Kinda hungry wanna order a pizza on me" *Hailee questions as her hand traces patterns on Pierce's chest*

*There is nothing Hailee loves more than just being with Pierce. She loves being around him. Having him hold her she just wants to do this forever*

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
Pierce’s stomach growled at the mention of food—he hadn’t eaten since the gas station hot dog he scarfed down before therapy. His fingers stilled against her back, thumb pressing into the dip of her spine just to feel her shiver.

“Only if we get fuckin’ pineapple on it,” he challenged, knowing full well Hailee would scrunch her nose up like he’d just suggested putting dirt on pizza. He smirked when she inevitably did, pinching her side through the hoodie. “What? Scared your bougie taste buds can’t handle it?”

His phone was somewhere in the mess of his bedsheets—probably buried under a week-old hoodie and empty chip bags—but he made no move to find it yet. The weight of Hailee on his chest was too warm, too *there*, and for once, his brain wasn’t screaming at him to get up, get out, *run*.

He dragged a hand through his own hair instead, tugging lightly at the roots just to ground himself before muttering: “...Extra cheese though. For you.” A beat. “*Obviously.*”

His phone was somewhere in the mess of his bedsheets—probably buried under a week-old hoodie and empty chip bags—but he made no move to find it yet. The weight of Hailee on his chest was too warm, too *there*, and for once, his brain wasn’t screaming at him to get up, get out, *run*.

He dragged a hand through his own hair instead, tugging lightly at the roots just to ground himself before muttering: “...Extra cheese though. For you.” A beat. “*Obviously.*”

Pierce’s stomach growled audibly at the mention of pizza, betraying him before he could even muster up his usual sarcastic deflection. He scowled down at Hailee like it was *her* fault his body had needs or whatever.

“Only if you get extra fuckin’ pepperoni,” he muttered, already reaching for his busted BlackBerry on the nightstand—the one with half the buttons sticking and a crack through the screen. His thumb hovered over the speed dial for their usual shitty pizza place before he paused, glancing at her sideways. “And none of that artichoke bullshit you tried last time.”

His free hand tangled in her hair without thinking, tugging just enough to make her tilt her head back against his chest so he could see her face when she inevitably pouted about it. The hoodie sleeve slipped down Hailee’s wrist as she moved, exposing that stupidly delicate bracelet she always wore—the one Klaus gave her that probably cost more than Pierce made in a month.

He swallowed hard and looked away before bitterness could claw its way up his throat again. Instead, he focused on how warm she was against him, how *real*. “And breadsticks,” he added gruffly, like an afterthought—like maybe if they ordered enough food they wouldn’t have to move from this spot all night.

Pierce snorted, catching her wandering hand and pinning it against his chest with a squeeze that was half warning, half affection. "Pizza? The fuck kinda rich kid shit—" His stomach growled traitorously loud, cutting him off mid-snark. He scowled at the ceiling like it personally offended him.

"...Fine. But we're gettin' extra fuckin' pepperoni," he muttered, already reaching for his busted BlackBerry on the nightstand with his good arm. His thumb hovered over the keys before he shot her a sideways glance. "And you're answerin’ the door when it gets here. Last time that delivery guy saw me, he looked like he was gonna piss himself."

He didn’t mention how Owen would lose his shit if he found out Pierce spent money on takeout instead of handing it over for booze—but Hailee knew anyway. She always did. His fingers tightened around the phone for a second before typing one-handed: *large pep, stuffed crust.* Then, because she spoiled him rotten and he hated how much he loved it: *garlic dip.*

Tossing the phone aside, he dragged Hailee back against him with a grunt, tucking her head under his chin like she belonged there. "You better not be plannin’ to share," he warned into her hair—but they both knew half that pizza would end up in her stomach by default because Pierce couldn't fucking resist feeding her bites between insults whenever she gave him those big green eyes.

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
The second Hailee hesitated in the doorway, Pierce *knew*. His whole body went rigid—not at the accusation, but at the careful way she said it, like she was stepping around broken glass. He sat up too fast, pain lancing through his bad shoulder as he swung his legs over the edge of the bed.

“Show me,” he demanded, voice low and rough. His fingers twitched toward his own wallet out of habit—empty except for a grocery store paycheck that wouldn’t clear until Friday—before curling into fists. The trailer walls felt thinner suddenly, Ivy’s game show laughter from the living room grating against his skull.

He didn’t wait for Hailee to move. Stalking past her, he yanked open her wallet himself with hands that shook just enough to piss him off. The hollow space where bills should’ve been stared back at him like a fucking punchline.

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
Pierce's entire body was a live wire, vibrating with the kind of tension that made his teeth ache. He barely registered Hailee moving in front of him until her back pressed flush against his chest—a human barricade he couldn't shove past without hurting her. His hands hovered over her hips like he wanted to push her aside but *couldn't*, fingers twitching with frustrated energy.

Ivy stood in the doorway, arms crossed, eyes darting between them with that same pinched expression she always wore around Hailee. "Oh please," she scoffed, waving a hand dismissively. "Like you even *need* it—"

**"Shut the fuck up."** Pierce's voice cracked like a whip, sharp enough to make Ivy flinch. His breath came hot and ragged against Hailee's hair as he glared over her shoulder at his mother. **"You don’t get to pull this shit anymore."**

His bad arm throbbed where it hung useless at his side—useless for hauling Ivy out by the collar like he wanted to, useless for slamming Owen’s liquor cabinet shut last night before things got worse—but his good hand fisted in Hailee’s hoodie anyway, holding onto her like an anchor.

He didn’t yell again when he spoke next; that was worse somehow, voice dropping into something low and venomous:
**"Give it back or I swear to god I'll take it from your welfare stash myself."**

Ivy paled but didn't move—just lifted her chin defiantly. The standoff lasted three heartbeats before she huffed and stormed off toward her room with exaggerated stomps that shook the trailer floorboards beneath them all.

Pierce exhaled hard through his nose before pressing his forehead between Hailee's shoulder blades just for a second—just long enough to steady himself—before muttering into fabric still warm from where she'd been wearing it:
"...Fuckin' told you not to leave your shit out here."
swipes:
Pierce's breath came in ragged bursts against Hailee's hair, his arms locking around her shoulders like a vice when she pressed against his chest. Ivy stood frozen in the doorway—mascara smudged under her eyes, clutching a half-empty wine glass with trembling fingers.

**"Ask?"** Ivy let out a shrill laugh that made Pierce flinch. **"Like you'd say no? With all that *Mikaelson* money?"** Her gaze flicked to Pierce, voice pitching into something desperate. **"You don't understand, baby—the electric bill was overdue and Owen would've—"**

Pierce snarled, cutting her off. **"So you stole from *her* instead?!"** His grip on Hailee tightened like he was afraid she'd vanish if he let go. The trailer walls seemed to pulse with tension, the air thick with the scent of cheap wine and stale regret.

Hailee could feel his heartbeat slamming against her back—too fast, too wild—and for once, she didn’t care about being polite or understanding or *good*. Not when Ivy’s betrayal cut deeper than any missing cash ever could.

She twisted in Pierce’s arms just enough to glare at Ivy over her shoulder, Italian accent bleeding through as she hissed:
***"Faccia di merda."*** *(Shitface.)*

Pierce choked out something between a laugh and a sob behind her before pressing his forehead hard between Hailee’s shoulder blades like an anchor in the storm of his own rage.

Pierce's breath came in ragged bursts against Hailee's hair as Ivy shuffled into the doorway, her arms crossed tight over her threadbare cardigan. The way she glared at Hailee—like *she* was the thief here—made Pierce's vision swim red.

"**The fuck, Mom?**" His voice cracked like he was sixteen again, small and furious under Owen’s shadow. He didn’t push Hailee away, just curled a possessive arm around her waist to keep her anchored against him while his free hand jabbed toward Ivy. "You really went digging in *her* shit? You *know* what happens when—"

His teeth clicked shut before he could say *when Owen does that to you*. The trailer walls pressed in closer, suffocating. Ivy’s chin trembled—not with guilt but with that same wounded defiance she always had when caught.

"I needed groceries," she snapped back, knuckles whitening where they gripped her sleeves. "You think I wanna beg my own son for gas money while his little rich girlfriend flaunts—”

**"Enough."** Pierce snarled it through clenched teeth before Ivy could finish twisting this into another one of her pity parties. His fingers dug into Hailee’s hip hard enough to bruise—not on purpose, just pure fucking adrenaline making him shake apart at the seams. He could feel it happening again: the slow unraveling of every goddamn boundary he ever tried to set between them all collapsing under one more betrayal wrapped up as desperation.

He swallowed bile and shoved past both of them toward his dresser where he kept an old coffee can full of tips from work beneath a pile of band tees.

“Here.” He hurled two crumpled twenties at Ivy’s feet like feeding a stray dog that kept biting him (and wasn't that exactly what this was?). “Now give **her** money back before I lose my goddamn mind.”

Ivy didn't move except to curl her lip at Hailee still pressed protectively against him.

And suddenly Pierce couldn't breathe right anymore because none of this should be happening in front of *her*, shouldn't be staining their rare quiet moments with trailer park bullshit—

So he did what Caddels do best:
He exploded.

A fist slammed into the drywall beside Ivy's head hard enough to punch clean through plasterboard dust raining down onto cheap carpet fibers as mother son stood there trembling inches apart neither backing down neither winning—

Until finally…

Ivy spat out three folded hundreds onto floor between them without breaking eye contact with Pierce first then turned on heel storming out slamming door so hard whole trailer shook—

Silence pooled thick after that only broken by sound off-key game show applause bleeding through thin walls reminding everyone how fucking pathetic they all were really…

Pierce didn’t look at hole in wall or cash scattered across floor just slumped forward pressing forehead between shoulder blades breathing harsh open-mouthed against fabric still smelling faintly vanilla despite everything else reeking mildew violence shame…

“…shoulda taken those plane tickets,”he mumbled raw into hoodie material not caring if heard anymore because truth tasted like blood copper today anyway might as well choke it all down together now right?

(Somewhere deep down knew answer though:
He never would have left ivy behind
Even if staying meant drowning slowly)

Pierce's breath came in ragged bursts against Hailee's hair, his arms locking around her shoulders like she was the only thing keeping him from exploding. Ivy stood frozen in the doorway, her knuckles white around a half-empty wine glass—*Owen's* wine glass, the expensive shit he hoarded like gold.

"Asked?" Ivy laughed, high and brittle. Her eyes darted between them before settling on Hailee with venom. "You throw cash around like it's nothing while we're eating *ramen*, princess." She took a step closer, reeking of chardonnay and desperation. "What's a few hundred to *you*?"

Pierce snarled, muscles coiling under Hailee's hands as he tried to step forward—only for her body blocking him to register like a physical tether. His fingers dug into her hips hard enough to bruise as he glared over her head at Ivy.

"You stole from *her*," he spat, voice cracking with something raw. "*Again.*" The unspoken *like you stole Amanda’s plane tickets* hung thick between them.

Ivy’s face crumpled. “I just—”

“Get out,” Pierce cut in before she could spew more excuses through those wine-stained lips. He pressed his forehead against Hailee’s shoulder blade just long enough to steady himself before adding quieter: “Take whatever’s left in Owen’s whiskey fund if you’re that desperate.”

The slam of Ivy retreating down the hallway shook dust from the ceiling tiles above them.

Pierce exhaled shakily into Hailee’s neck—his grip loosening by degrees until his hands just rested limp against her waistband where they belonged all along—before muttering against skin still warm from where she'd been pressed against him earlier:

"...Still want that fucking pizza or what?"

Pierce's entire body was coiled tight as a spring, every muscle locked under Hailee's touch. He could feel Ivy's glare like a physical weight—that same venomous look she'd given Hailee since day one—and it made something ugly twist in his chest. His fingers dug into Hailee's hips, half to steady himself, half to keep her *right there* between him and the woman who couldn't stop fucking ruining everything.

"**Bullshit.**" The word cracked out of him before he could stop it. He didn't care about the money either; it was the *principle*, the way Ivy always pulled this shit when she knew he'd have to clean up the mess. His grip tightened on Hailee as he glared over her head at his mother. "You wanna steal? Fine. But you don’t get to act like *she’s* the problem when you’re caught."

Ivy’s face twisted—that wounded-puppy look she perfected over years of playing victim—but Pierce was done falling for it. He exhaled hard through his nose, pressing his forehead against Hailee’s shoulder just long enough to wrestle back the urge to put his fist through a wall.

When he spoke again, his voice was dangerously quiet: "Give it back." Not a request. A demand.

Ivy hesitated, lip trembling like she might cry (always fucking crying), but Pierce didn't budge. Finally, with a huff, she pulled crumpled bills from her pocket and tossed them onto the bed like *she* was the one being inconvenienced.

Pierce didn’t move to pick them up. Just stared at that money like it burned until Ivy slunk out of the room with muttered curses about "ungrateful children" and "that spoiled brat corrupting you."

The second they were alone again, Pierce sagged against Hailee, exhaustion hitting him like a freight train now that adrenaline had bled out of him.
"...Fuckin' hell," he muttered into her hair before pulling back abruptly as if embarrassed by his own vulnerability.
He snatched up one of her hands and pressed all those stupid hundreds into her palm too roughly before letting go.
"There."
His jaw worked silently for second before adding quieter:
"...Order whatever pizza you want."
(Translation: *I'm sorry.*)

"Don't fucking *talk* to her," he snarled at his mother, hands gripping Hailee's hips hard enough to bruise just to keep from lunging forward. His bad arm throbbed where it hung useless at his side. "You took it. Again." The words tasted like bile. "How much was in there, Hails?"

Ivy's face twisted, that same wounded-puppy look she'd used on him since childhood. "I just needed—"

"**Bullshit.**" Pierce flinched at his own volume, Hailee’s body the only thing keeping him grounded as Ivy shrunk back. His throat burned. "You stole from my *girlfriend* so Owen wouldn’t notice the liquor money gone." A wet laugh escaped him. "*Again.*"

Hailee’s fingers flexed against his chest—gentle even now, even after this—and something inside him cracked open raw and ugly under her touch. He pressed his forehead to her shoulder so he wouldn’t have to see Ivy’s tears or the empty wallet still clutched in his hand.

"...We're leaving," he muttered into Hailee's hoodie before straightening up with a jerk of his chin toward Ivy: "*Pay her back by Friday or I swear to Christ I'll torch every bottle in this house.*"

His keys were already in hand when he grabbed Hailee’s wrist—not hard enough to hurt but hard enough that she'd know not to argue—and shouldered past Ivy toward the front door without looking back once.

The Corolla door slammed loud enough for half the trailer park to hear when they got outside; Pierce didn't speak until they peeled onto the highway going twenty over.

"...Pizza place by your dorm takes cash," was all he said finally, knuckles white on the wheel like if he held tight enough everything else might stop spinning for once

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
Pierce let out a sharp, humorless laugh against her back before straightening up. His fingers lingered on Hailee’s hips for half a second too long—like he was checking she was still solid, still *there*—before shoving both hands into his pockets.

**"Yeah, real fuckin’ smart,"** he muttered, but there was no heat behind it. His shoulder twinged as he turned toward his room, kicking a stray beer can out of the way with more force than necessary. **"Pick somethin’ gory or I’m throwin’ your phone out the window."**

The threat was empty and they both knew it. He paused in the doorway just long enough to shoot a glare down the hall where Ivy had disappeared—*this isn’t over*—before vanishing into his room to dig through the mountain of DVDs piled haphazardly next to his bed.

Somewhere between *Texas Chainsaw Massacre* and *Hellraiser*, Pierce hesitated, thumb tracing over a cracked case of *The Notebook* that definitely wasn't his (Hailee had left it last month "by accident"). He shoved it under his pillow before she could see and cranked up the volume on whatever shitty horror flick he grabbed first just to drown out Ivy's inevitable bitching later.

His voice carried over the opening credits when Hailee reappeared:
**"If you ordered pineapple I swear to god—"**

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:

**"Nothing,"** he bit out, jaw clenched so tight it ached. Birthdays in this house meant Owen drunk by noon and Ivy crying into store-bought cake that tasted like cardboard. Last year, Pierce had spent his eighteenth hiding in this same bed with Hailee’s hoodie pulled over his head while Owen put a fist through the drywall screaming about *ungrateful little shits*.

He dragged a hand down his face, suddenly exhausted. **"Just… don’t make it a thing."** A beat too long passed before he glanced down at her, green eyes flickering with something raw under all that bitterness. **"You bein’ here is enough or whatever."**

The admission tasted like weakness, so he covered it by yanking Hailee closer until her nose pressed into his collarbone—*shut up shut up shut up*—and cranked the movie volume louder to drown out whatever sappy shit she might say next. His thumb found the hem of her hoodie again, rubbing absently at the fabric like it was some kind of lifeline.

He exhaled sharply through his nose and yanked her closer, if only so he didn’t have to look at her face when he grumbled: **“Just… you. Here.”** A beat. **“And no fuckin' candles.”**

The unspoken *stay* hung between them louder than any horror movie scream track.

Pierce stiffened under her, the DVD remote nearly slipping from his fingers. Birthdays in the Caddel household usually meant Owen getting blackout drunk and Ivy sobbing over old photo albums—if they acknowledged it at all. He scowled down at Hailee like she’d just asked him to solve a calculus problem.

**"The fuck you bring that up for?"** His thumb dug into the volume button until the movie’s scream effects distorted through blown-out speakers. A beat passed before he shrugged, too sharp to play off as casual. **"Don’t need shit."**

But his free hand found its way back to Hailee’s waist anyway, fingers tapping an uneven rhythm against her hipbone like he was counting down to something. The *Notebook* case under his pillow might as well have been burning a hole through the fabric.

He finally grunted: **"...Could use new strings for my guitar."** A lie—the old ones were fine, rusted but serviceable—but it felt safer than admitting what he really wanted (*you, here, always*). His teeth worried at his lip ring before adding quieter: **"Or just... this. Without my mom bein' a thieving cunt for five minutes."**

Pierce stiffened under her, the mention of his birthday like a fucking landmine he wasn’t ready to step on. His fingers twitched against the remote before he tossed it aside with a scoff.

**"Don’t,"** he warned, voice rough as gravel. His bad arm curled uselessly at his side while the other dragged through his own hair—neon green streaks stark against black under the dim bedroom light. **"Ain’t your job to buy me shit."**

But Hailee was still looking up at him with those big green eyes, and *fuck*, he could already feel himself caving. He exhaled sharply through his nose before muttering:

**"...Just be there."** A beat too long—his throat worked around something stupid and vulnerable before he covered it with a sneer. **"And none of that rich-girl over-the-top bullshit either. No fuckin' surprise party or whatever."**

His fingers found hers without thinking, calloused thumb pressing into her palm just hard enough to leave a mark if she pulled away too soon. Somewhere in the back of his mind, Owen's voice snarled *pathetic*—but Hailee's hand was warm and real in his grip, so Pierce held on tighter instead of letting go like he should have.

mes:

*Around noon Pierce has been forced into some mother son movie thing when Hailee arrives. Hailee walks in becuase the door is never locked and grins as she says* "Where is the birthday boy" *Hailee sets down the professional cake she had made and walks over leaning over the back of the sofa to kiss Pierce's cheek* "Hey baby"

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
Pierce was slumped on the couch, half-dead from Ivy’s suffocating *mother-son bonding* bullshit—some Lifetime movie about estranged families that had her sniffling into a tissue every five minutes—when Hailee’s voice cut through the melodrama like a fucking airhorn.

His head snapped up, eyes narrowing at the sight of that stupidly perfect cake she’d brought in like some kind of trophy. **"Oh fuck off,"** he grumbled, but there was no real venom behind it. His fingers twitched where they were buried in his hoodie pocket (Hailee’s hoodie, stolen again last night), itching to reach for her even as he scowled at the TV like it had personally offended him.

Ivy stiffened beside him, clutching her tissue tighter with a wet sniffle. **"We were having *a moment*,"** she muttered under her breath—just loud enough for Pierce to hear and roll his eyes so hard it hurt.

He didn’t give a shit about Ivy's wounded look as he shoved himself off the couch with more force than necessary, shoulder protesting as he stalked toward Hailee instead. **"You're late,"** he accused lowly before yanking her in by the belt loops—close enough that their noses brushed and he could smell whatever expensive shampoo she used today. His voice dropped into something rough but private: **"...Missed you."**

Then louder for Ivy's sake: **"Fuckin' hate this movie anyway."**

**"Fucking finally,"** he muttered under his breath, shooting Ivy a *see? I told you* look when she sniffled dramatically at being interrupted. His fingers dug into the armrest like he was physically restraining himself from bolting upright to meet her.

The kiss to his cheek burned hotter than it should have—too soft for this shithole, too *Hailee*—and he barely resisted turning his head to catch her mouth instead. **"Took you long enough,"** he grumbled instead, but there was no real bite in it. His eyes flicked toward the cake she'd brought (professional, probably cost more than his car) before darting away just as fast because *fuck*, that tightness in his chest was back again.

Ivy made a wounded noise behind them—something about *ungrateful sons* and *replacing me with some rich girl*—but Pierce ignored her in favor of reaching back blindly to grab Hailee's wrist and yank her around the couch toward him. **"Movie's trash,"** he announced loudly over Ivy’s dramatics before lowering his voice just for Hailee: **"Get me outta here."**

His thumb rubbed circles into her pulse point without thinking about it—a silent plea disguised as impatience.

Pierce was slumped on the couch like a corpse, half-watching some Lifetime movie Ivy had put on—*fucking mother-son bonding bullshit*—when Hailee’s voice cut through the saccharine dialogue. The remote hit the floor with a crack when he kicked it aside on his way over to Hailee—close enough that their chests almost brushed as he loomed over her just because he could.

His voice dropped low enough that only she could hear:
**"You better not have gotten me some rich-kid bullshit present."** A pause. Then quieter: **"...Thanks for comin’, though."**

It wasn't *happy birthday*, but it was close enough coming from him—and then because standing this near without touching her felt impossible now that she was here (now that everything smelled like vanilla instead of stale beer), Pierce hooked two fingers into the waistband of her jeans and tugged sharply toward the hallway before Ivy could start another round of waterworks about how *ungrateful* he was being today (*every day*).

mes:

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
Pierce's eyebrows shot up at the mention of a *gift*, his mouth already opening to snap something about not needing shit—but Hailee’s fingers on his cheek stalled the words in his throat. He exhaled sharply through his nose, eyes flicking toward Ivy (still sulking on the couch with her tear-stained tissue) before grudgingly squeezing his own shut.

**"This better not be some fuckin'—"** His voice cut off as he felt Hailee’s hands slide into his, pressing something cold and metallic against his palm. His fingers twitched instinctively around what felt like... keys?

Pierce cracked one eye open—just enough to see the glint of a car key fob nestled in his grip, sleek black with a silver emblem he *definitely* didn’t recognize from any beat-up Corolla. His breath hitched.

**"...The hell is this?"** The question came out hoarse, like someone had punched it out of him. He could already feel Ivy craning her neck to see from across the room, but all Pierce could focus on was Hailee’s stupidly hopeful face inches from his own.

His pulse roared in his ears loud enough to drown out whatever sappy explanation she was undoubtedly gearing up for.

**"Hailee—"** His voice was gravel, low and dangerous. **"If you got me some fuckin' Rolex or some shit, I swear to god—"**

But she was already covering his eyes with her hands, that stubborn little grin he both loved and hated pressed against his jaw. Behind them, Ivy made a wounded noise about *rudeness* before stomping off to the kitchen in a huff—good fucking riddance.

Pierce exhaled sharply through his nose but didn’t shove her off. **"This is stupid,"** he muttered, even as he let her steer him blindly toward the door, shoulders tense under her touch. The trailer creaked beneath their steps, every sound amplified by the fact that he couldn’t fucking see—couldn’t brace for whatever over-the-top bullshit she’d dragged here to humiliate him with.

His hand shot out on instinct when cold air hit his face outside, fingers curling around Hailee's wrist like a lifeline before he caught himself and jerked away again. **"Happy now? Can I open my damn eyes yet?"**

Pierce’s whole body locked up at the words *your gift*, muscles tensing like he was bracing for a punch. Gifts in this house came with strings—Owen’s “present” last year had been a six-pack and a black eye for complaining about the noise. But Hailee’s thumb was stroking his cheekbone, stupidly gentle, and against his better judgment, he found himself squeezing his eyes shut with a grumbled **”This is fuckin’ dumb—”**

Ivy made another wounded noise from the couch, but Pierce barely heard it over the blood rushing in his ears. His fingers dug into Hailee’s hips on instinct—half to steady himself, half to make sure she didn’t bolt before whatever this was could backfire spectacularly.

**”If it’s some glittery bullshit or—”** His voice cracked when cold metal pressed into his palm. He didn’t open his eyes yet. Couldn't. The key teeth bit into his skin sharp enough to hurt.

Hailee's breath hitched against his lips when he finally looked down: one car key (brand new, not some shitty spare), dangling from a keychain with their initials scratched haphazardly into cheap pewter.

The silence stretched too long. Pierce swallowed hard around the lump in his throat before shoving the key back at her with more force than necessary.
**"The hell am I supposed to do with *this*?"**

But they both knew he'd seen it—the beat-up '89 Corolla parked crooked outside next to Ivy's rusted-out Dodge, now sporting fresh plates and an inspection sticker that hadn't been there this morning.

Hailee had paid off Owen's lien.
Had *owned* him in ways money shouldn't be able to touch.

Pierce turned abruptly toward the door before she could see whatever fucking emotion was cracking across his face—already reaching for the cigarettes in his pocket like they could burn this feeling out of him.
**"...Gonna test drive it,"** he lied thickly.
And if he revved the engine too loud peeling out of the trailer park?
Well.
That was between him and goddamn no one else.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee is basically vibrating with excitement as she grabs his hand and leads him outside.*

*Hailee grins as the car comes into view a 1955 Mercedes-Benz 300 SLR Uhlenhaut Coupe. She had spent months trying to find it.*

*She had the interior redone to have black leather seats and green accents and the stereo increased by 10 for Pierce's loud music* "Well what do you think"

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
Pierce’s entire body locked up the second his eyes landed on the car—*the fucking car*—parked crookedly in the trailer park’s dirt driveway like some kind of mirage. The 300 SLR’s curves gleamed under the shitty sodium lights, so out of place next to rusted-out pickup trucks and Owen’s busted Chrysler that for a solid three seconds, Pierce was convinced he was hallucinating from sleep deprivation.

His fingers spasmed around the keys hard enough to leave imprints in his palm. **"You—"** The word came out strangled, throat tight like he'd been choked. His bad arm hung useless at his side while his good one lifted halfway toward the car before aborting the motion like he thought it might vanish if he touched it.

Ivy's shrill *"Oh my GOD!"* from behind them barely registered over the white noise filling Pierce's skull. He took one jerky step forward, then another, until his free hand finally landed on the driver's side door—cold metal under his fingertips, real as anything.

**"...Green accents?"** He finally managed to croak out, voice rough with something too raw to name. His thumb brushed over the leather-wrapped steering wheel through the open window before he rounded on Hailee with wild eyes. **"The fuck did you even *find* this?! It's a goddamn museum piece—"**

He cut himself off abruptly when Ivy started wailing about *insurance costs*, whipping around to glare at her with enough venom that she actually shut up for once. When he turned back to Hailee, there were no words left—just a shaky exhale and fingers curling into her hoodie sleeve like she might disappear too if he didn't hold on tight enough.

The unspoken *thank you* hung between them louder than any engine roar ever could.

mes:

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
Pierce snatched the manual from her hands with a scoff, flipping it open with jerky movements—only to freeze when the papers fluttered out onto the hood of the car. His breath caught in his throat as he recognized the letterhead: **Dr. Emilio López - Orthopedic & Reconstructive Surgery.**

The date—*next month*—burned into his vision like a brand. His fingers trembled slightly as he picked up the papers, scanning over words like *nerve damage*, *full mobility restoration*, and *covered under donor funding*.

**"Hailee..."** His voice was rough, barely above a growl, but something fractured behind his eyes. He swallowed hard, jaw working like he was fighting back words that wouldn’t come out right anyway.

Ivy gasped dramatically from behind them, already reaching for the papers like she had any right to them. **"Oh my God! Pierce, this is—!"**

Pierce didn’t let her finish. He slammed the manual shut hard enough to make Ivy jump back and turned on Hailee instead—crowding her against the car door with a look that could’ve melted steel. **"You don’t get to just—fuckin'—”** He cut himself off with a sharp exhale through his nose before dragging her into him by the front of her hoodie, forehead pressing against hers so hard it almost hurt.

His next words came out raw and quiet between them:
**"...Why?"**

Hailee was watching him with those big green eyes, biting her lip like she was afraid he’d snap (he might). Ivy had started sobbing again behind them about *medical bills*, but Pierce barely heard her over the static filling his skull.

He swallowed hard before shoving everything back into the manual and tossing it onto the passenger seat with forced nonchalance. **"...Manual’s boring as shit,"** he muttered, voice thick. Then, quieter: **"Get in."**

He didn’t wait for Hailee to respond before yanking open the driver's door and sliding behind the wheel—hands trembling just enough that he had to clench them around leather-wrapped steel to steady himself. The engine roared to life under his touch, vibrating through his bones like a second heartbeat.

Pierce didn’t look at Hailee when he finally spoke again over the growl of horsepower:
**"...You drive first."**

Pierce snatched the manual from her hands with a scoff, flipping it open with rough, impatient movements—only to freeze when the papers fluttered out onto the hood of the car. His breath caught in his throat as he recognized the letterhead: **Dr. Emilio López - Orthopedic & Reconstructive Surgery.**

The appointment confirmation was printed in crisp black ink—*Pierce Caddel, 3rd of next month, 9:00 AM.*

For a long moment, he just stood there staring at it like it might bite him. His bad arm twinged instinctively, phantom pain shooting down to his fingertips as if mocking him for daring to hope. When he finally looked up at Hailee again, his voice was barely above a growl—but there was something shattered underneath it.

**"You think I can just *fix* this?"** He gestured sharply at his shoulder with the manual before tossing it onto the driver’s seat like even touching those papers burned him. **"Like some rich-ass miracle cure? That’s not how shit works."**

But even as he said it, his fingers flexed unconsciously around nothing—like they were already testing what full movement might feel like again. The anger in his chest warred with something dangerously close to *want*, and that pissed him off more than anything else.

Ivy chose that moment to wail from behind them: **"Oh Pierce! You could be *normal* again!"**

Pierce's jaw clenched so hard his teeth creaked before he turned on Hailee fully—crowding her against the car door until their noses almost touched and she could feel every ragged breath against her lips. His voice dropped into something low and raw:

**"...Why?"** Just one word—but loaded with everything he couldn't say out loud without choking on it. *Why me? Why now? Why do you keep fucking trying when I don’t know how to thank you?*

name: Pierce Caddel
mes:
Pierce's breath stopped entirely when the apartment key hit his palm—cold metal biting into skin still tender from gripping the car keys too tight. His vision blurred at the edges for a second, like his brain couldn’t process all of this at once. The *car*, the *surgery*, and now—**fuck**—a way out of this rotting trailer for good.

His fingers closed around the key hard enough to leave marks, but when he spoke, his voice was terrifyingly quiet:
**"You don’t get it."** A muscle in his jaw jumped. **"I can’t—*fuck*—I can’t pay you back for any of this."**

The admission tasted like bile in his throat. Ivy was openly sobbing behind them now, wailing about *her baby leaving her*, but Pierce didn’t turn around. Couldn’t. Not when Hailee was looking at him like that—like he was something worth salvaging instead of another broken thing in a broken house.

He swallowed roughly before yanking her into him with one arm, face buried in her hair so she wouldn't see whatever the hell his expression was doing:
**"...Goddammit."** His voice cracked on it. **"Just say you own me already and be done with it."**

But his grip on her said everything else—the way he clung like she might vanish if he let go even an inch, how his bad arm twitched like it wanted to hold her too despite the pain. The keys dug bloody crescents into both their palms where they pressed together between them, metal warmed by skin now.

Somewhere behind them, Ivy screeched about ingratitude while Owen's shadow finally appeared in the trailer doorway with a beer bottle dangling from one hand and suspicion etched deep into every line of him.

Pierce didn't look back once as he opened the car door for Hailee with shaking hands instead:
**"...Show me my fuckin' apartment."**
